title: New American Gladiators Look
content:
Does anyone know if all of this type is based on an existing face? Or if it's custom for the show? Thanks

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [AG Header.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141023210558/http:/typophile.com/files/AG%20Header.jpg) | 35.59 KB |
| [AG Blog.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141023210558/http:/typophile.com/files/AG%20Blog.jpg) | 26.85 KB |
author: Sam Serif

comments.content: I don't know, but it's not so good. Looks like NBC pay as much for fonts as they do for writers. Consider [Changeling](http://web.archive.org/web/20141023210558/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/mark_simonson/changeling/) or [FF Qtype](http://web.archive.org/web/20141023210558/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_qtype_semi_extended_ot/).

What are the odds that it's a custom font?

The logotype seems to have a slightly different DNA than the supporting copy.
I think they are free fonts. I feel like I've seen both many times before.

The thin font in pic #1 is Eigenstate Wide and no longer on the market.

[http://www.typophile.com/node/19513](http://web.archive.org/web/20141023210558/http:/www.typophile.com/node/19513 "http://www.typophile.com/node/19513")

The thin font in pic #2 is Xenotron.
